/* Regex pattern for date-time in DD/MM/YYYY with 24-hour time */

* Check whether the provided input matches a supported date-time format
* If matches, it would be parsed as {@link LocalDateTime} and
* return a display format: {@code "MMM dd uuuu h.mma"}.
* If the input does not match any support format, return the original input
* @param input The user input data that was stored in the Task
* @return A normalized date-time string if matches the regex, else original input.

* Handles loading and storing task data from text file on disk
* Each line in the text file represent a single task.
* Each task parameters are separated using underscore ("_") separators
/** The path to the file where tasks are stored. */
* Initializes the storage with the specified file path.
* @param filePath Path to the data file.
* Loads tasks from the given file path and return them as ArrayList
* @return An {@link ArrayList} of loaded {@link Task} objects, or null if the file is not found.
// If the file do not exist, create the file and return empty ArrayList
// If the path include parent, but parent do not exist:
* Saves the given list of tasks to the data file at the specified file path.
* Each line in the text file represent a single task.
* Each task parameters are separated using underscore ("_") separators
* @param tasks The {@link ArrayList} of task to be saved
* @return {@code true} if the tasks were successfully written to disk, otherwise {@code false}.
* Provides methods to show messages and read user input.
/** Scanner function to read the user input */
private final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
* Reads the input from the user.
* @return The string entered by the user.
* A greeting message displayed when the chatbot starts
System.out.println("\t Hello! I'm Guma\n\t What can I do for you?");
* A farewell message displayed when the chatbot ends
System.out.println("\t Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");

* Notifies the user that a task has been marked as completed.
* @param taskName  The description of the completed task.
System.out.println(String.format("\tNice! I've marked this task as done:\n\t%s", taskName));
* Notifies the user that a task has been marked as not completed.
* @param taskName  The description of the task.
System.out.println(String.format("\tOk, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n\t%s", taskName));

public void getDeletion(String taskName, int size) {
"\n\t Now you have %s tasks in the list",

* Command to add a task to the task list.

System.out.println(">> ERR: Unable to add task into the TaskList!");
/** Indicates whether this command should terminate the application. */
* Checks if the application should exit after this command.
* @return true if the application should exit, false otherwise.
* @param tasks   The task list to operate on.
* @param ui      The user interface to show messages.
* @param storage The storage to save/load data.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Command to mark a task as completed.
/** Index of the task to be marked complete in the tasks */
* Initializes the command with the index of the task to be marked.
* @param idx The 1-based index of the task.
* Executes the task completion and updates storage.
* @param tasks   The task list to operate on.
* @param ui      The user interface to show messages.
* @param storage The storage to save/load data.
* @throws GumaException If the task index is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws GumaException {
throw new GumaException(">> ERR: CompleteCommand::Unable to mark task as complete");
* Command to delete a task from the task list.
/** Index of the task to be unmarked in the tasks */
* Initializes the command with the index of the task to be deleted.
* @param idx The 1-based index of the task.
* Executes the task deletion and updates storage.
* @param tasks   The task list to operate on.
* @param ui      The user interface to show messages.
* @param storage The storage to save/load data.
* @throws GumaException If the task index is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws GumaException {
throw new GumaException(">> ERR: DeleteCommand::Unable to delete task!");
* Executes the exit procedure, saving tasks and showing farewell message.
* @param tasks   The task list to operate on.
* @param ui      The user interface to show messages.
* @param storage The storage to save data.
* @throws GumaException If there is an error saving tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws GumaException {
throw new GumaException(">> ERR: ExitCommand::Error in saving files!");
* Returns true to indicate that the application should exit.
* Command to find all tasks that contains the user input

* @param tasks   The task list to be displayed.
* @param ui      The user interface to show the list.
* @param storage The storage (unused in this command).
* @throws GumaException If there is an error listing tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws GumaException {
throw new GumaException(">> ERR: FindTask::Unable to find and list tasks!");
* Command to list all tasks in the task list.

* @param ui      The user interface to show the list.
* @param storage The storage (unused in this command).
* @throws GumaException If there is an error listing tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws GumaException {
throw new GumaException(">> ERR: ListCommand::Unable to list tasks!");
